University of Lisbon, Dep. of Informatics
lxsuite@di.fc.ul.pt
ID.description: Marks Portuguese sentence boundaries with <s>...</s>, and paragraph boundaries with <p>...</p>. Handles standard written dialogue conventions in Portuguese texts.
Sentence chunker for Portuguese

ID.title: LX-tokenizer
ID.creator: António Branco and João Silva
University of Lisbon, Dep. of Informatics
Antonio.Branco@di.fc.ul.pt
ID.description: Segments Portuguese text into lexically relevant tokens; Expands contractions; Marks spacing around punctuation or symbols; Detaches clitic pronouns from the verb, signaling possible vocalic alternations; Detaches the preposition de from the verb haver and removes the hyphen; Detaches special word endings marking alternative terminations.
Tokenizer for Portuguese

ID.title: LX-tagger
ID.creator: António Branco and João Silva
University of Lisbon, Dep. of Informatics
Antonio.Branco@di.fc.ul.pt
ID.description: Assigns a single morpho-syntactic tag, from the 19 tag tagset, to every token; Each individual token in multi-token expressions gets the tag of that expression prefixed by 'L' and followed by the number of its position. This tagger was developed with TnT software over 90% of an accurately hand tagged corpus. Accuracy of 97.22% was obtained with one run test over a held out evaluation corpus with the remainder 10%.
Tagger for Portuguese

ID.title: EVTRAN 2.0
ID.creator: softex
softex@hn.vnn.vn
ID.description: English to Vietnamese Machine Translation software ver. 2.0 based on transfer technology fully automatic machine translation, translates .doc, .txt, .html,.rtf file formats and interactive translation
English to Vietnamese Machine Translation

ID.title: ExtraLink
ID.creator: Feiyu Xu, Tim vor der Brück
LT-Lab, DFKI GmbH, Germany
feiyu@dfki.de
ID.description:
The utilization of language technology for the creation of hyperlinks has a long history. Information extraction (IE) is a technology that can be applied to identifying both sources and targets of new hyperlinks. IE systems are becoming commercially viable in supporting diverse information discovery and management tasks. Similarly, automatic hyperlinking is a maturing technology designed to interrelate pieces of information, using ontologies to define the relationships. With ExtraLink, we present a novel information system that integrates both technologies in order to reach at an improved level of informativeness and comfort. Extraction and link generation occur completely in the background. Entities identified by the IE system are mapped into a domain ontology that relates concepts to a structured selection of predefined hyperlinks, which can be directly visualized on demand using a standard web browser. This way, the user can, while reading a text, immediately link up textual information to the Internet or to any other document base without accessing a search engine.
The quality of the link targets is much higher than with standard search engines since, first of all, only domain-specific interpretations are sought, and second, the ontology provides additional structure, including related information.
ExtraLink uses as its IE system SProUT, a generic multilingual shallow analysis platform, which currently provides linguistic processing resources for English, German, Italian, French, Spanish, Czech, Polish, Japanese, and Chinese. SProUT is used for tokenization, morphological analysis, and named entity recognition in free texts.
We present a novel information system integrating advanced information extraction technology and aut

ID.title: Proteus Conversational Interface
ID.creator: Ted Warring
Artificial Ingenuity, LLC
Ted.Warring@Artificialingenuity.com
ID.description: The Proteus conversational interface architecture centers around a "fuzzy logic" based pattern matching system for specific responsive behaviors. The processing model (or "Brain") is not a simple "couplet" or "one-liner" non-contextual system as are many "chat-bot" type designs, nor is it an immense case structure as is well known public domain designs. State and contextual knowledge can be modeled in several ways within the Proteus architecture. The 'Brain" maintains "State" and "Mode" specific structures, as well as facility for use of discrete facts, and "Collections" which represent classes or collections of information. The fuzzy logic system incorporates facility to reference discrete or abstracted class information, as well as the current Brain State and Mode, from within the behavior determinism functions, allowing unprecedented richness of behavioral models from within a single architecture. The design implements "Modes" of operation, which provide completely separate behavioral structures to implement non integrated, or modal, behaviorisms. Meaning different personality of emotional states may be implemented by separate modes of behavior. This feature can further be used to isolate and simplify subject specific interactions, such as for "help-desk", or expert-system style functionality. The "State" functionality provides for state specific behaviors within the clauses or predicates of a given behavioral mode. This provides for a simplified topical or behavioral modifier to be made to existing clauses and predicates. This may be utilized to simulate "moods", or topical deviations based upon subject matter. All data functions of the Proteus architecture are dynamic, meaning that facts and collections may be updated or added to dynamically as a function of the user's interaction with the knowledge base. This facilitates Proteus learning user specific information, as well as contextual facilities for complex heuristic behavior. This can be used in such fashion to allow Proteus to be taught by interaction, as well as by data insertion. Further, as of version 5.0 self-modifying knowledge bases are supported. The current version also supports procedural behavior, as well as decision tree type of expert system functionality. Complicated diagnostic or procedural functionality can be designed as a decision tree within the Proteus knowledge base to facilitate use in business or technical assistant applications. This complements the conversational aspects of the Proteus technology to provide truly usable expert systems. Lastly, there is an interface provided to the OpenMind Commonsense Database of 500,000 facts.
Conversational interface using fuzzy matching and complex knowledge representation

ID.title: ThoughtTreasure
ID.creator: Erik T. Mueller
noemail@nodomain.com
ID.description: ThoughtTreasure is a commonsense knowledge base and architecture for natural language processing that uses multiple representations including logic, finite automata, grids, and scripts. The ThoughtTreasure knowledge base consists of: * 35,000 English words and phrases, * 21,000 French words and phrases, * 27,000 concepts, and * 51,000 commonsense assertions about those concepts. The ThoughtTreasure architecture consists of: * a text agency for tagging words, phrases, and named entities in text, * a syntactic component for producing syntactic parse trees, * a semantic component for producing surface-level semantic parses and resolving anaphora, * a generator for converting assertions into English and French, * a planning agency for achieving goals in a simulated world, and * an understanding agency for producing an in-depth understanding of a text.
NLP tools and commonsense knowledge base

ID.title: LangSuite
ID.creator: PetaMem
info@petamem.com
ID.description: LangSuite combines several NLP/NLU functionality in one system. The architecture of this system is a distributed client/server (e.g. running on linux clusters). With this a customer may do: * Human-Quality Fully Automated Translation. And we mean it. We understand that our systems cannot cope with TL native speakers because of still many idioms missing in our Lexica, but we can beat the average translator that "only studied" a TL. And we haven't finished the development... This is the LangTrans component. * Language Identification and content categorization. Plus a rule framework that allows for dispatching. This is the LangInfo component. You can plug LangInfo to - say - info@ibm.com and it will throw away spam and deliver incoming emails to qualified users. (So spanish pre-sales questions will go there, english complaints there, and italian orders there...) * Excerpts of texts. Users may let the system summarize up a m pages document to n pages, where m >> n. They may also combine it with the MT feature. Thus summarize a 100 pages english document and present the result on 2 pages *in german*. * There is a dialogue component with pragmatics memory plus there are 2 ontologies for Pre-Sales and Tech-Support available, so you can create your own Pre-Sales and Tech-Support Dialogue Agents and plug them behind the LangInfo component. So your callcenter will contain LangInfo as the dispatcher and some of the callcenter employees are humans, some are SW-agents.
commercial NLP/NLU system

ID.title: An Gramadóir
ID.creator: Kevin P. Scannell
Saint Louis University, USA
scannell@slu.edu
ID.description: An Gramadóir is an open-source grammar checker for the Irish language. It contains a part-of-speech tagger, rule-based disambiguation module, and detects errors with simple pattern matching. It is intended as a platform for more advanced NLP tools for Irish.
Irish language grammar checker

ID.title: TIGER API
ID.creator: Oezguer Demir, Hajo Keffer, Vaclav Nemcik
Saarland University, Computational Linguistics
oeze@coli.uni-sb.de
ID.description: A Java interface to the TIGER corpus and other corpora encoded in TiGerXML. The TIGER API provides a complete interface to the TIGER corpus and other corpora encoded in TiGerXML. It allows Java programmers to easily access the structure of corpus given as an TiGerXML file. Methods for traversing the trees, accessing single elements such as nodes, non-terminals, terminals, sentences, words and so on are provided.
A Java interface to the TIGER corpus and other corpora encoded in TiGerXML

ID.title: KMap IME
ID.creator: Eisvogel <eisvogel@users.sourceforge.net>
jgim@gmx.net
ID.description: KMapIME provides a Java service providers (spi) that enables the user to type any alphabet covered in the Unicode standart. Currently supports over 100 languages.
multilingual input method

ID.title: EDBL: Lexical database of Basque (Euskararako Dat
ID.creator: IXA Taldea. University of the Basque Country.
Department of Languages and Computer Systems. University of the Basque Country (Euskal Herriko Unibe
jipanoso@si.ehu.es
ID.description: EDBL (Lexical DataBase for Basque) is the lexical basis needed for the automatic treatment of Basque. It was first developed as a lexical support fot the spelling checker and corrector XUXEN, but in the course of the time it has proved to be a multipurpose tool. Nowadays, it is not only the lexical support of the speller but also of the morphological analyser MORFEUS and the lemmatiser EUSLEM. In the future, it will be also used for syntactic and semantical analysis. Being neutral in relation to linguistic formalisms, flexible, open and easy to use, EDBL is, along with corpora, an essential tool for the Natural Language Processing. It is made up of about 75.000 entries divided into dictionary entries (the same you can find in a conventional dictionay), verb forms and dependent morphemes, all of them with their respective morphological information. EDBL is organized in a hierarchical structure, according to a category-system adapted to Basque. It aims to reflect the general lexicon of standard Basque (Euskara Batua) and it is the essential lexical information-store for Basque NLP. It may be consulted via internet.
Lexical basis needed for the automatic treatment of Basque.

ID.title: IMS Corpus Workbench (CWB)
ID.creator: Oliver Christ, Stefan Evert
IMS, University of Stuttgart
evert@ims.uni-stuttgart.de
ID.description: The IMS Corpus Workbench is a software suite for encoding and querying large text corpora (up to 300 million tokens). CQP, the corpus query processor, allows for fast and flexible searching. All tools in the suite are command line tools running on the Solaris or Linux operating system.
fast corpus query command line tool

ID.title: LingPipe
ID.creator: Bob Carpenter, Breck Baldwin
Alias-I
lingpipe@alias-i.com
ID.description: LingPipe is a suite of Java tools designed to perform linguistic analysis on natural language data. While fast and robust enough to be used in a customer-facing commercial system, LingPipe's flexibility and included source make it appropriate for research use. Version 1.0 tools include a statistical named-entity detector, a heuristic sentence boundary detector, and a heuristic within-document coreference resolution engine. Named entity extraction models are included for English news and English genomics domains, and can be trained for other languages and genres.
Named-entity, sentence boundaries and coreference

ID.title: Phono
ID.creator: Lee Hartman
Southern Illinois University, USA
lhartman@siu.edu
ID.description: Phono is a software tool for developing and testing models of regular historical sound change. If you wish to test a sound-change model for which you have an ordered set of rules and a set of ancestor words, or if you teach about the operation of regular sound change, Phono may be useful to you.
Phono (Version 4.1 for Windows) is a software tool for developing and testing models of regular historical sound change.

ID.title: BabelCode Project
ID.creator: Yao Ziyuan
Fudan University
info@babelcode.org
ID.description: BabelCode Project investigates a new methodology of controlled translation and makes it available for practical use. By-products such as foreign language writing assistants and learning tools are also useful applications based on BabelCode databases.
A new methodology of controlled translation and its implementation

ID.title: ICTCLAS: Chinese Lexical Analysis System
ID.creator: Hua-Ping ZHANG
Inst. of Computing Tech.m Chinese Academy of Sciences
zhanghp@software.ict.ac.cn
ID.description: Word is the minimum meaningful unit of languages. It’s well known that there are no separators between words in Chinese text. Therefore, Chinese lexical analysis is a prerequisite to Chinese information processing. Based on years of research, we have developed a Chinese lexical analysis system ICTCLAS (Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Lexical Analysis System) using an approach based on casacaded HMM. ICTCLAS includes word segmentation, Part-Of-Speech tagging and unknown words recognition. Its segmentation precision is 97.58%(result from recent official evaluation in national 973 project). It achieved two first rank and one second rank in the international word segmentation bakeoff held by ACL SIGHAN. ICTCLAS were broadly reported in China and abroad as well. Until Sep., ICTCLAS had been downloaded by over 4,000 researchers or commercial organizations from China, Japan, Singapore, Korea, USA and other countries or areas. We are honored to distribute ICTCLAS free of fees and help users solve problems from Chinese lexical analysis. In addition, we provide ICTCLAS API for developers invoking in their own systems. Any question, comments or advice about ICTCLAS are welcomed.
Chinese word segmentation; Part-of-Speech tagging, named entity recognition

ID.title: Ellogon
ID.creator: George Petasis, Vangelis Karkaletsis
National Center for Scientific Research (NCSR) "Demokritos", Institute of Informatics & Telecommunic
ellogon@iit.demokritos.gr
ID.description: Ellogon is a multi-lingual, cross-platform, general-purpose language engineering environment, developed in order to aid both researchers in computational linguistics, as well as companies that produce and deliver language engineering systems. Ellogon offers an extensive set of facilities, including tools for processing and visualising textual/HTML/XML data and associated linguistic information, support for lexical resources (like creating and embedding lexicons), tools for creating annotated corpora, accessing databases, comparing annotated data, or transforming linguistic information into vectors for use with various machine learning algorithms. Ellogon belongs to the category of referential or annotation based platforms, where the linguistic information is stored separately from the textual data, having references back to the original text. Based on the TIPSTER data model, Ellogon provides infrastructure for: - Managing, storing and exchanging textual data as well as the associated linguistic information. - Creating, embedding and managing linguistic processing components. - Facilitating communication among different linguistic components by defining a suitable programming interface (API). - Visualising textual data and associated linguistic information.
Ellogon is a language engineering platform that offers a large number of facilities, including tools

ID.title: Copernic Summarizer
ID.creator: Copernic Technologies
Copernic Technologies
*@copernic.com
ID.description: Text Summarization: Key Concept and Key Sentence Identification.
Copernic Summarizer can analyze a text of any length, on any subject, in any one of four languages.

ID.title: Infomap NLP
ID.creator: Scott Cederberg, Dominic Widdows
CSLI
infomap-nlp-devel@lists.sourceforge.net
ID.description: The Infomap NLP Software package uses a variant of Latent Semantic Analysis (LSA) on free-text corpora to learn vectors representing the meanings of words in a vector-space known as WordSpace. It indexes the documents in the corpora it processes, and can perform information retrieval and word-word semantic similarity computations using the resulting model. Novel features include a negation operator which uses orthogonal projection, as in quantum logic. The software has been used for lexical aquisition, disambiguation, relation extraction and document retrieval. The software has successfully been compiled and run under various versions of Linux, Solaris, MacOS X and Windows (using Cygwin).
The Infomap NLP Software package builds WordSpace models for analysing semantic similarities in corp

ID.title: DT 1.2
ID.creator: Dialogue Technologies
alsen.b@dialoguetech.com
ID.description: Fully functional question/answer development product, including dictionaries, grammers, tools for application building, logging functions etc.
Question/answer system

ID.title: Mentext 1.0
ID.creator: Mimosil Technology Ltd
Mimosil Technology Ltd
enquiries@mimosil.co.uk
ID.description: Mentext is an AI technology developed by Mimosil for working with plain English text. It is aimed primarily at developers and is supplied as a software component. Using Mentext's natural language processing capabilities, developers can enable their software to identify meaning or information conveyed in text, regardless of the words used. By utilising the capabilities of Mentext, an application can: - search a set of documents for a document about a given topic - search within a document for a particular piece of information - identify the meaning of an email or text typed by a user - compare 2 pieces of text to see if they mean the same thing. Mentext's advanced technology can yield significant benefits to the developer, in terms of increased functionality and reduced development time, by providing these capabilities in an off-the-shelf component which is simple to integrate into their software solutions.
AI component which identifies meaning or information conveyed in English text

ID.title: Textalyser
ID.creator: Bernhard Huber
none
info@textalyser.net
ID.description: An online text statistic and analysis tool
An online text statistic and analysis tool

ID.title: WordMetry
ID.creator: FindSolution
FindSolution
guoshesen@21cn.com
ID.description: WordMetry is a tool for analysis of word statistics, stylometrics, author identification, corpus linguistics,opinion poll,media focus, and prediction. It supports web-based text retrieval and analysis as well as traditional locally-based static text statistics. Main features include: 1. Count word frequency, percentage and rank. 2. Sorting words functions including most linguistics word order methods. 3. Limitless number of generations of author/works/texts statistics for paralell comparison and analysis. 4. Separate display and operation of independent data set. 5. Convert statistics to overlapping chart. 6. Export data to Ms Excel. 7. Webpage/file search analysis. 8. Whole text KWIC. 9. Multi keywords simultaneously search. 10.Concordancer 11.Major world media opinion analysis. 12.File chopper to build customized corpus database for equal sample analysis. 13.Built-in browser for reading news. 14.Built-in HTTP and FTP client to get remote author works availabe. 15.Author texts sentences statistics and comparison. 16.Monitor machine internet history for history web text analysis. 17.Simultaneously open more files for merged text analysis. 18.Search author/works from web. 19.Multi-threads support for fast and simultaneous retrieval and processing. ...
WordMetry is a tool for analysis of word statistics, stylometrics, author identification, corpus lin

ID.title: AlignmentSet
ID.creator: Patrik Lambert
TALP Research Center, Technical University of Catalonia, Barcelona, Spain
lambert@talp.upc.es
ID.description: This module is a perl Library (and command-line utilities) to manage an Alignment Set, i.e. a set of sentence pairs aligned at the word (or phrase) level. It provides various methods to display the links, to evaluate the alignments against a reference, or to symmetrize an asymmetric (with respect to source and target) alignment. It also provides functions to be applied to each alignment of the set. One of the objectives of the module is to allow the user to perform all these basic operations without bothering with the particular physical format of the Alignment Set. Anyway it also provides format conversion methods.
Toolkit to manage (display, evaluate, process) a set of sentence pairs aligned at the word (or phras

ID.title: MedScan TextMiner
ID.creator: Nikolai Daraseila et al
Ariadne Genomics Inc.
info@ariadnegenomics.com
ID.description: MedScan is advanced scientific text mining software tool for automated extraction of biological facts from scientific literature and MEDLINE abstracts.
MedScan is advanced scientific text mining software tool for automated extraction of biological fact

ID.title: AnswerBus Question Answering System
ID.creator: Zhiping Zheng
Saarland University, Computational Linguistics Department
zheng@coli.uni-sb.de
ID.description: AnswerBus (http://www.answerbus.com/) is an open-domain natural language question answering system (QA) and intelligent search engine. It consists of a Web system that uses the entire Internet as its knowledge base, and a local system that can be implemented on any collection of information, or corpus. One example of local implementation is the AnswerBus News (http://www.answerbus.com/news/), which was based on a collection of 700,000 CNN news pages. The AnswerBus Web system receives a user question, analyzes question type, converts the question into a query, and sends the query to several major search engines. Potential answers to the question were extracted from the results returned by the search engines, ranked and returned to the user. The AnswerBus local system contains its own search engine designed specifically for QA tasks. AnswerBus News Engine indexed 700,000 news stories published on the CNN website since 1996. We believe that currently it is the largest indexed knowledge base for QA tasks. The local system is a combination of question answering and search engine where users can choose to either ask a question or enter a search query. New technologies used in the Web or local systems include sentence-question matching formula, QA specific dictionary, light natural language processing components, dynamic named entities extraction, multi-layer caching, and QA specific indexing and search engine. As compared to regular search engines, AnswerBus provides a more natural interface that leads users directly to the very needed answers, thus can significantly shorten users’ navigation path and ease the information retrieval effort. Its local system can be implemented in corporations and organizations, for example, on an Intranet site, to help employees easily locate job related information and enhance productivity. DMOZ Open Directory lists AnswerBus as an artificial intelligence application and also a meta search engine.
An Open-domain Naural Language Question answering System and Intelligent Search Engine

ID.title: JavaRAP
ID.creator: Long Qiu
School of Computing, National University of Singapore
qiul@comp.nus.edu.sg
ID.description: JavaRAP is a standalone, publicly-available implementation of the Resolution of Anaphora Procedure (RAP) given by Lappin and Leass (1994). The RAP algorithm resolves third person pronouns, lexical anaphors, and identifies pleonastic pronouns. The implementation uses the standard, publicly available Charniak (2000) parser as input, and generates a list of anaphora-antecedent pairs as output. Alternately, an in-place substitution of the anaphors with their antecedents can be produced. It could be used as a reference to benchmark other anaphora resolution algorithms or systems; or provide anaphora resolution function to larger NLP applications.
A standalone, free implementation of the Resolution of Anaphora Procedure (RAP) given by Lappin and

ID.title: STEP
ID.creator: Michael Minock
University of Umea
mjm@cs.umu.se
ID.description: STEP is a portable natural language interface (NLI) to relational databases.
STEP is a portable natural language interface (NLI) to relational databases.

ID.title: Answer Anywhere
ID.creator: Babak Hodjat
iAnywhere Solutions
info@ianywhere.com
ID.description: Adaptive Agent Oriented Software Architecture (AAOSA) is used for Natural Language Interfaces (NLI). To create an NLI using AAOSA, an engineer will model the application, not the language, in the form of an agent network. Each agent is responsible for a semantic concept in the application, and reports to an agent up-chain, which represents a broader concept. When an agent network is presented with an input request, agents make claims to a role in responding to the input. This session will include demonstrations of natural language processing at work in multiple mobile applications.
Agent-based Distributed NLI

ID.title: theConcept
ID.creator: Mesa Dynamics, LLC
software@mesadynamics.com
ID.description: A text mining application that reads and analyzes electronic documents for keyword identification, content categorization and contextual research. theConcept extracts text from local files and Internet web sites, condensing documents into an index to relevant citations of significant words and phrases in the text.
Text mining on the web or desktop

ID.title: LanguageTool
ID.creator: Daniel Naber
daniel.naber@t-online.de
ID.description: LanguageTool is a rule-based language checker that will find errors for which an error pattern is defined in its XML configuration files. About 40 rules that detect style and grammar errors in English texts are included. New rules can also easily be implemented in Python. A file with more than 200 annotated "real-world" grammar and style errors is included.
Open Source language checker

ID.title: TextSTAT
ID.creator: Matthias Hüning
Free University Berlin
mhuening@zedat.fu-berlin.de
ID.description: TextSTAT - 'Simple Text Analysis Tool' Concordance software for Windows and Linux (free/open source) TextSTAT is a simple programme for the analysis of texts. It reads ASCII/ANSI texts (in different encodings) and HTML files (directly from the internet) and it produces word frequency lists and concordances from these files. This version includes a web-spider which reads as many pages as you want from a particular website and puts them in a TextSTAT-corpus. The new news-reader puts news messages in a TextSTAT-readable corpus file. In TextSTAT you can use regular expression which provides you with powerful search possibilities. The programme is multilingual. Because it uses Unicode internally, TextSTAT can cope with many different languages and file encodings. The user interface comes in three languages: English, German, and Dutch.
Concordance software for Windows and Linux

ID.title: SFST Tools
ID.creator: Helmut Schmid
IMS, University of Stuttgart
schmid@ims.uni-stuttgart.de
ID.description: A fast and easy-to-use finite-state-transducer toolbox for the implementation of morphological analysers and similar tools. The implementation is based on a C++ library.
Stuttgart Finite State Transducer Tools

ID.title: Trifeed's KE(TM)
ID.creator: Trifeed Ltd.
Trifeed Ltd.
oran@trifeed.com
ID.description: * Knowledge and Entity Extraction. * Content driven Meta-data generation. * Unstructured text tagging. * Automatic hyperlinking.
Knowledge extraction capability

ID.title: ELAN
ID.creator: H. Brugman, H. Sloetjes, A. Russel, A. Klassmann
MPI for Psycholinguistics
software@mpi.nl
ID.description:
ELAN is a tool that allows to annotate sound and video streams and to analyze annotated media files. Each user can define his/her own annotation tiers and encoding details in a flexible way, can annotate with a high time accuracy and can carry out modifications at any time. The annotations are stored in XML files the structure of which is close to the AG model. For analysis purposes several synchronized viewers are available and users can search for complex patterns in the annotations.
The software is available under GNU license mdoel.
ELAN is a tool that allows you to create, edit, visualize and search annotations for media streams.

ID.title: Kiswahili spellchecker
ID.creator: Jason Githeko, Dwayne Bailey
Egerton University, translate.org.za
githeko@avu.org
ID.description: Kiswahili language spelling checkers for Linux, Mozilla and OpenOffice.org. Kiswahili is spoken by about 100 million people in East and Central Africa
Kiswahili language spelling checkers

ID.title: Insight Discoverer Extractor
ID.creator: TEMIS
info@temis-goup.com
ID.description: Insight Discoverer™ Extractor is an information extraction server dedicated to analysis of text documents. It detects pieces of information that are the most relevant to users: a merger announcement in an article for an analyst, a sales opportunity in an e-mail for a customer relationship manager, a specific skill in a resumé for a recruiter, for example. The knowledge extraction is powered by Skill Cartridges™, a hierarchy of knowledge components (lexicon and/or an extraction rule) describing the information to extract for a given business, specific field or topic. An extraction rule describes a sentence structure that characterizes a concept.
Information extraction server

ID.title: Insight Discoverer Categorizer
ID.creator: TEMIS
info@temis-group.com
ID.description: Insight Discoverer™ Categorizer is a document categorization server. It automatically classifies unstructured documents into pre-defined categories, combining statistical and linguistic analysis rules.
Information Categorization server

ID.title: Insight Discoverer Clusterer
ID.creator: TEMIS
info@temis-group.com
ID.description: Insight Discoverer™ Clusterer is an automated classification server that dynamically groups documents according to their semantic similarity. It proposes the most relevant classification for a given document collection. Users can then browse through their documents organized according to theme and sub-theme. They have both an overview of the information and different avenues to explore. It is therefore easier to find and appropriate relevant information.
Information classification server

ID.title: RealPro
ID.creator: Benoit Lavoie and Owen Rambow
CoGenTex, Inc.
realpro@cogentex.com
ID.description: RealPro is CoGenTex's cross-platform, high performance syntactic realizer. Written entirely in portable JAVA, RealPro is designed to perform syntactic realization -- i.e, the transformation of abstract syntactic specifications of natural language sentences (or phrases) into their corresponding surface forms -- at speeds suitable for interactive processing.
Deep-syntactic sentence realizer

ID.title: WinPitch Pro
ID.creator: Philippe Martin
info@winpitch.com
ID.description: Windows based speech analysis tool, with extended capabilities for multimedia analysis, real time fundamental frequency and spectrogram, corpus transcription and alignment, and more. Unicode compliant.
WinPitchPro

ID.title: LEAP
ID.creator: Chuck Cosby
Leverance
chuckc@leverance.com
ID.description: This is a natural language understanding system that works to understand a users question or command. The system will then perform a database query or direct an external software program to perform the indicated action. the name 'LEAP' stands for Language Enabled Application Platform. LEAP allows users to 'Language Enable' thier existing applications by placing a natural language front end on those applications. LEAP also has interfaces for speech recognition systems as well. Leverance has developed unique ways of improving the accuracy of speech recogntion by using deep natural language processing to select from the n-best lists that are output from some speach recognition systems, such as IBM Via Voice. LEAP uses a 'Concept Matrix Mapping' method to achieve extremely accurate understanding of a users sentence. LEAP also provides a response to each users statment to create a truely conversational feel to the system
Language Recognition and Understanding

ID.title: O.L.A.
ID.creator: Ralf Claassens
Acklin B.V. (www.acklin.nl)
ralf@acklin.nl
ID.description: This English Question/Answer system is template-based and is not very sophisticated. However, this open source NLG system can be used in many practical and online cases. O.L.A. is developed in Linux environment in AWK programming code (see website). The gaps of the randomly chosen template sentences are filled with usage of external data. Furthermore, an example of an avatar will be generated (form: smilie). Download will be possible soon.
template-based Q&A system with simplistic avatar

ID.title: Wordcorr
ID.creator: Joseph E. Grimes
SIL International, University of Hawai`i at Manoa
webmaster@wordcorr.org
ID.description: Wordcorr automates the tedious and risky process of tabulating and managing the sound correspondences used in working out the historical development of natural languages. It gives access to all the data, all the time. Initial support was from NSF.
Tool for Comparative Linguistics

ID.title: Balie
ID.creator: Pythonner
NRC
pythonner@gmail.com
ID.description: Balie is a system for multilingual textual information extraction (IE). IE consist in finding and structuring data from free-written texts. Examples of IE tasks include named-entity recognition (NER), identification of proteins, abbreviation resolution, keyphrase extraction, identification of semantic roles and a large amount of much specific tasks (e.g.: finding e-mails, urls). Some tasks, like the last ones given, may be easily tackled by the use of regular expressions or simple rules. However, more complex tasks like NER, requires efficient and flexible architecture. Balie is driven by the need of such a flexible IE architecture. As is, Balie will not extract a particular type of information from text but it will transform the text in a TokenList that is the key element in many IE tasks. The following components of Balie are required to create a rich TokenList: 1. Language detection; 2. Tokenization; 3. Sentence boundary detection; 4. Part-of-speech tagging;
Baseline Information Extraction

ID.title: Carabao DIY Machine Translation Kit
ID.creator: Vadim Berman
bermanv@zahav.net.il
ID.description: Carabao (full name: Carabao Do-It-Yourself Machine Translation Kit) is a completely open machine translation toolkit. It allows creation of your own machine translation interlingua-modeled databases and using them on-the-fly. Unique capabilities of Carabao and effective data entry allow using it as a testbed for linguistic models and creation of specialized dictionaries. Features include: * Faster and more nuance-tolerant word entry. * Style sensitivity and control - ability to reshape the result so it will bear the same meaning but in different style. For example, the user may write a phrase using common words in French, and the program would translate it into official style in English. * Model and entities are grammar-independent and are suitable for any language without the need to reprogram or even recompile. Lexical data is stored in transactional database. * Interlingual approach to storing lexical data. * Descriptive mini-language for collocations, rules and idioms that allows effective handling of lexical holes. * Inline conversion of measures. * Built-in customized instant dictionary printing capability. * Built-in thesaurus for words and idioms found in the processed text. * Ability to trace the translation process. Carabao architecture and general concepts are somewhat similar to architecture of Ariane system created by Vauquois & Boitet in 1985. (Although during Carabao's creation the author didn't know that.) Hopefully it will take off from the point where Ariane stopped because of the untimely death of Bernard Vauqois (ambitious, I know).
Carabao is a machine translation toolkit. Openness, unique capabilities of Carabao and effective da

ID.title: SenseClusters
ID.creator: Ted Pedersen, Amruta Purandare, Anagha Kulkarni
University of Minnesota, Duluth
tpederse@umn.edu
ID.description: A suit of Perl programs that allows clustering of similar text units, such as words, sentences or documents. SenseClusters has been useful in a number of NLP tasks such as Word Sense Discrimination, Document Organization, Synonymy Identification or even Discourse Modeling...
clustering techniques for word senses discrimination

ID.title: Alexandria
ID.creator: Dr. D. Dutoit, P. de Torcy, Y. Picand
MEMODATA
d.dutoit@memodata.com
ID.description: With "Alexandria", MEMODATA provides a new, innovative interface for its multilingual dictionary (scaled up to 14 languages), which has been (and will be) sold under the name "Dicologique" or "Integral dictionary". Alexandria is a javascript-implemented tool which can be installed very easily in any website, adding to it a dictionary function. The visitors of the site can double-click any word of the site and obtain its translation (in one of the 14 languages) or its defintion (in French or in English) displayed in a small window. Every word of this window is itself a "hyperlink" and can be followed by double-clicking it for complementary information.
Multilingual Dictionary for Websites

ID.title: MORFEUS
ID.creator: IXA Taldea. University of the Basque Country
Department of Language and Computer Systems
i.alegria@ehu.es
ID.description: MORFEUS is a robust and wide-coverage morphological analyser for Basque. The analyser is based on the two-level formalism and has been designed in an incremental way with three main modules: the standard analyser, the analyser of linguistic variants, and the analyser without lexicon which can recognize word-forms without having their lemmas in the lexicon. Using lexical transducers for our analyser we have improved both the performance of the different components of the system and the description itself. The analyser is a basic tool for current and future work on automatic processing of Basque and its first two applications are a commercial spelling corrector and a general purpose lemmatizer/tagger
Morphological analyser for Basque

ID.title: Callisto
ID.creator: Chad McHenry, Robyn Kozierok, David Day
MITRE Corp.
day@mitre.org
ID.description: The Callisto annotation tool was developed to support linguistic annotation of textual sources for any Unicode-supported language. Callisto has been built with a modular design, and utilizes standoff-annotation, allowing for unique tag-set definitions and domain dependent interfaces. Standoff-annotation support, provided by jATLAS, allows for nearly any annotation task to be represented. The modular design of Callisto allows it to be extended with user interface components specific to a domain. Default tag editing capabilities are provided through a highlighted text display, and tag attribute tables. As domain specific extension components are developed, they may be integrated into the core of Callisto, to become part of the standard suite of available components.
Configurable annotation workbench

ID.title: BioRAT
ID.creator: David Corney, David Jones and Bernard Buxton
University College London
d.corney@cs.ucl.ac.uk
ID.description: BioRAT is an information extraction tool, which is specifically designed to perform biomedical IE. It is able to locate and analyse both abstracts and full-length papers from the Internet. BioRAT is a Biological Research Assistant for Text mining. It includes a template-design tool; a gazetteer editor; a web spider. It aims to be easy-to-use for biological researchers.
Biological information extraction

ID.title: EXTRAKT
ID.creator: TEXTEC Software
TEXTEC Software
office@medianova.de
ID.description: EXTRAKT3 ist ein Add-On zu jeder Suchfunktion, das das Auffinden jeder Information durch den Einsatz von sehr umfangreichen Wörterbüchern (Grundformen-, Komposita-, Synonym- und Übersetzungswörterbüchern), sowie durch die Anwendung linguistischer Verfahren unterstützt.
EXTRAKT3 - Empowered Web Search

ID.title: Intellexer - natural language searching technologi
ID.creator: EffectiveSoft
EffectiveSoft
yuri.kitin@effective-soft.com
ID.description: Intellexer allows developing knowledge management tools, document comparison software and document summarization software, custom built search engines and other intelligent software.
Document comparison software

ID.title: Heart of Gold
ID.creator: Ulrich Schäfer
DFKI Language Technology Lab
ulrich.schaefer@dfki.de
ID.description: Heart of Gold is a middleware for the integration of deep and shallow natural language processing components. It provides a uniform and flexible infrastructure for building applications that use Robust Minimal Recursion Semantics (RMRS) and/or general XML standoff annotation produced by NLP components. The main purpose Heart of Gold was developed for is integration of various shallow NLP processors with the highly efficient HPSG parser PET in order to increase robustness of HPSG grammars for various languages such as English, German, Japanese, Greek and Norwegian. HPSG grammars can be developed with LKB, compiled to a binary grammar image, and at runtime executed by PET within the Heart of Gold. Although the focus of Heart of Gold is deep-shallow integration, the framework itself is generic and hence could also be used to, e.g., combine multiple purely shallow systems on XML basis, or to integrate other deep parsers. The Heart of Gold has been developed under the wings of the EU-funded project DeepThought (completed in October 2004) and the BMBF-funded project Quetal (ongoing) and in the context of the DELPH-IN collaboration. The core middleware (and also the PET system) is available under an LGPL open source license. For details see the License section. However, some of the components for which adapters are provided are only available for research purposes or have their own licenses different from LGPL.
XML-based middleware for the integration of deep and shallow natural language processing components

ID.title: YazykVisual
ID.creator: Nash Lincoln
University of Iowa
nashira-lincoln@uiowa.edu
ID.description: YazykVisual is a java application that animates the working of a part-of-speech tagger using an HMM and the Viterbi algorithm. It is meant to be used in a computational linguistics class by instructors of as a teaching aid, and by students as a learning aid.
HMM and Viterbi Visualizer

ID.title: Lemur Toolkit
ID.creator: CIIR, LTI
University of Massachusetts, Carnegie Mellon University
info@lemurproject.org
ID.description: The Lemur Toolkit is designed to facilitate research in language modeling and information retrieval, where IR is broadly interpreted to include such technologies as ad hoc and distributed retrieval, cross-language IR, summarization, filtering, and classification. The toolkit supports indexing of large-scale text databases, the construction of simple language models for documents, queries, or subcollections, and the implementation of retrieval systems based on language models as well as a variety of other retrieval models.
The Lemur Toolkit for Language Modeling and Information Retrieval

ID.title: Indri
ID.creator: CIIR, LTI
University of Massachusetts, Carnegie Mellon University
indri-info@ciir.cs.umass.edu
ID.description: Indri is a new search engine from the Lemur project; a cooperative effort between the University of Massachusetts and Carnegie Mellon University to build language modeling information retrieval tools. It provides a structured query language for retrieval and an indexer for indexing collections of documents.
Language modeling meets inference networks. Structured query language information retrieval.

ID.title: TITE
ID.creator: Viatcheslav Yatsko, Maxim Kozlov
Katanov state University of Khakasia, Abakan, Russia
slavay@khsu.ru
ID.description: TITE (translation in teaching English) is a bilingual translation system to be used in FLT during out-of-school activities. General idea underlining PASS is the following. At the beginning of the term a student is given a number of texts to be translated from his native tongue into the target language or vice versa. These texts fall into two groups: limited and unlimited. A limited text has a time limit: the student must translate it in the time allotted by the teacher (for example 15 minutes). If the student fails to keep within the time limit all the text translated by him is deleted. The translation stops as soon as he makes a mistake (enters an incorrect symbol). Unlimited texts are larger than limited ones and don’t have a time limit; the student can save the results and proceed with the translation next time. As soon as the student finishes translating the text a record is made in the log on the server so that the teacher can check student’s progress. By the end of the term the student must translate all texts assigned to him/her so as to get credit. TITE is a distributed system that comprises Student’s Module and Teacher’s Module linked by an SQL server.
A bilingual translation system to be used in FLT during out-of-school activities

ID.title: OpenThesaurus
ID.creator: Daniel Naber
sonstiges@danielnaber.de
ID.description: OpenThesaurus is an Open Source thesaurus for the German language and a lightweight German version of WordNet. It's organized in synsets and supports hypernym/hyponym relation between these synsets. Both the data and the software - a web application written in PHP - is available.
German thesaurus

ID.title: Boeing Simplified English Checker
ID.creator: Richard Wojcik, Philip Harrison
Boeing Phantom Works
richard.h.wojcik@boeing.com
ID.description: This product evaluates sentences and paragraphs for compliance with ASD Simplified Technical English, the controlled language writing standard for aerospace maintenance manuals.
Checker Software for Simplified Technical English

ID.title: Mohawk Virtual Human
ID.creator: Monica Peters
Monigarr Legacy Corporation
info@monigarr.com
ID.description: Monigarr Virtual Humans give students the ability to hear, see, and practice Endangered and Dead Languages from anyplace they may be. Hear the translations, at the speed of thought, with any standard or custom computer, mobile device, robotics, animatronics, smart devices, and home automation systems. The ability to hear, see, and practice a language instantly, at any time with virtual humans, brings the learner to fluency.
virtual human teachers; endangered & dead languages

ID.title: IDX
ID.creator: DFKI GmbH
busemann@dfki.de
ID.description: IDX achieves an excellent level of consistency in the indexing of large amounts of German or English text. IDX is able to determine the base words of derivations and compounds, so that every instance of a search term will be systematically found. Therefore IDX, when used in conjunction with other tools, forms an ideal basis for high performance information retrieval. IDX offers the following options: * Full text retrieval * Proper Name Recognition * Interfaces to information retrieval systems
Comprehensive indexing for German and English

ID.title: SVMTool
ID.creator: Jesus Gimenez and Lluis Marquez
Universitat Politecnica de Catalunya
jgimenez@lsi.upc.edu
ID.description: The SVMTool is a simple and effective part-of-speech tagger based on Support Vector Machines. By means of a rigorous experimental evaluation, we conclude that the proposed SVM-based tagger is robust and flexible for feature modelling (including lexicalization), trains efficiently with almost no parameters to tune, and is able to tag thousands of words per second, which makes it really practical for real NLP applications. Regarding accuracy, the SVM-based tagger significantly outperforms the TnT tagger exactly under the same conditions, and achieves a very competitive accuracy of 97.2% for English on the Wall Street Journal corpus, which is comparable to the best taggers reported up to date.
General Sequential Tagger based on Support Vector Machines

ID.title: FreeLing
ID.creator: TALP research center
Universitat Politecnica de Catalunya
nlp@lsi.upc.edu
ID.description: The FreeLing package consists of a library providing language analysis services (such as morfological analysis, date recognition, PoS tagging, etc.) The current version (1.2) of the package provides tokenizing, sentence splitting, morphological analysis, NE detection, date/number/currency recognition, PoS tagging, and chart-based shallow parsing. Future versions will improve performance in existing functionalities, as well as incorporate new features, such as NE classification, document classification, etc. FreeLing is designed to be used as an external library from any application requiring this kind of services. Nevertheless, a simple main program is also provided as a basic interface to the library, which enables the user to analyze text files from the command line.
An Open Source Suite of Language Analyzers

ID.title: Semantic Document Summarizer
ID.creator: EffectiveSoft Ltd.
EffectiveSoft Ltd.
contact@effectivesoft.com
ID.description: The Document Summarization solution allows you to generate a Summary. It contains the primary information and makes it unnecessary to read all of the documents.
Document Summarization – Intellexer Semantic Solution

ID.title: NuScribe
ID.creator: NuScribe
sales@nuscribe.com
ID.description: NuScribe is a full medical document management system that is voice recognition driven. The service is online and can be accessed from any PC that has an internet connection. The system utilizes powerful templates and macros to reduce dictation time by 50%.
NuScribe offers unlimited medical transcription for $199 per month

ID.title: LinguaStream
ID.creator: Frédérik Bilhaut & Antoine Widlöcher
GREYC, University of Caen
fbilhaut@xineo.net
ID.description: LinguaStream is above all a virtual laboratory targetted to researchers in NLP. It allows for complex experiments on corpora to be realised conveniently, using various types of declarative formalisms, and reducing considerably the development costs. Its uses range from corpora exploration to the development of fully functionnal automatic analysers. An integrated environment is provided with the platform, where all the steps of the realisation of an experiment can be achieved.
Integrated environment for experimentation in computational linguistics

ID.title: OpenMary
ID.creator: Marc Schröder
DFKI GmbH
schroed@dfki.de
ID.description:
MARY is a multi-lingual (German, English, Tibetan) and multi-platform (Windows, Linux, MacOs X and Solaris) speech synthesis system. It comes with an easy-to-use installer -- no technical expertise should be required for installation.

Main features:

* easy installation using web-based installer
- modularity: only install the components you need
- automated dependency checks: missing components can be downloaded automatically (http://mary.dfki.de/download)
* several languages and voices
> - German, English and Tibetan synthesis
- MBROLA and LPC diphone voices
- CMU ARCTIC cluster unit selection voices
- limited domain voices


* expressive speech synthesis
> - With the tool "EmoSpeak", MARY can synthesize emotionally expressive
speech using diphone voices
- Expressive unit selection voices exist
(e.g., a German football announcer)


* Markup support
- MARY can read and interpret several markup languages, including SSML (speech synthesis markup language) and APML (agent player markup language)
- Timing information for Embodied Conversational Agents (ECAs) and Talking Heads
- High parametrisability of prosody, e.g. for emotion expression, information status, etc.


* Stable client-server architecture
- Multi-threaded Java server, can be used in web applications
- GUI client is easy to use and powerful > - Example implementations of clients in other programming languages


* Incremental processing
- synthesized speech is produced incrementally as the input is processed. It can be sent to the client as an audio stream, so that the delay until the first sound is played is short even for large files
* Mailing list
- MARY users are invited to subscribe to the mary-users mailing list: http://www.dfki.de/mailman/listinfo/mary-users


* Development environment
- OpenMary development is based on a modern Trac-based system, featuring SVN-based source code versioning, ticket-based bug reports, and wiki-based documentation: http://mary.opendfki.de
- Project definition files for importing the source code into Eclipse
- Javadoc available online: http://mary.dfki.de/javadoc
- Plans for future releases include full unit selection support, JSAPI support, accessibility support for the client, and more. Volunteers are very welcome! For details, see: http://mary.opendfki.de/report/1


* Licenses
- the core OpenMary system, including English and Tibetan components, is released as open source under a BSD-style license;
- the German components are released under a DFKI research license;
- MBROLA binaries and voice databases are available under a non-commercial and non-military license.
Emotional Text-to-Speech Synthesis

ID.title: 2MPower Writing Support System
ID.creator: Arno Vigen
2MPower
support@kadarf.com
ID.description: This system divides any passage into its meaning (syntax) according to four elements. Currently, it can produce reports representing the relationships of two. It produces recommendations and grading for theme, organization, balance and focus.
Writing Support System

ID.title: SenseExplore Summarizer
ID.creator: Vitaly Demin
info@senseproject.com
ID.description: A text summarizer that is capable of highlighting summaries directly on Web pages in the browser window. A standalone clipboard summarizer is also included. Supports primarily English and Russian with minor (non-optimized) support of several other European languages.
Web and clipboard summarizer, capable of highlighting summaries directly on Web pages.

ID.title: AcronymaX
ID.creator: Mikhail Zislis
Software Species
mikhail.zislis@softwarespecies.com
ID.description: AcronymaX is a C++ library for high-performance, high-quality extraction and tagging of acronym/definition pairs in a natural language text. It is packaged as a Windows DLL that you can use from any language, such as C++, C#, or Java.
Automated extractor/tagger of acronym/definition pairs

ID.title: Topicalizer
ID.creator: Björn Wilmsmann
none
bjoern@topicalizer.com
ID.description: Topicalizer is a text analysis and topic extraction tool. Based on methods of computational linguistics it provides various analyses for a given URL or plain text. These comprise, amongst others, language recognition, lexical density, keywords, collocations, word and phrase frequencies, readability and a short abstract. Topicalizer can, for instance, be used for automatically tagging a website or blog entry with semantic information or for retrieving summaries for web pages.
Information extraction and analysis of various textual features

ID.title: Cypher
ID.creator: Monrai Technologies
support@monrai.com
ID.description: Cypher is one of the first software program available which generates the RDF graph and SeRQL query representations of a natural language input. The Cypher framework provides a set of robust definition languages, which can be used to extend and create grammars and lexicons. The Cypher specifications are designed to allow a novice to quickly and easily build transcoders for processing highly complex sentences and phrases of any natural language, and to cover any vocabulary.
Cypher is one of the first software program available which generates the RDF graph and SeRQL query

ID.title: ClearForest Semantic Web Services
ID.creator: ClearForest
Corporation
sws1@clearforest.com
ID.description: ClearForest SWS provides a web services based interface to a portion of our commercial toolkit. The service will extract items such as person, place, organization, company, geography from unstructured text.
Web services based entity extraction

ID.title: WICALE
ID.creator: Hong-Thai NGUYEN, Virginie CARPENA
NLP development aid
Hong-Thai.Nguyen@imag.fr
ID.description: connect to multi-NLP systems, exchange lingware, data, corpus, edit them in local. Actual connected systems: -PILAF - ARIANE -UNL
a generic lingware environment development for CAT systems

ID.title: lxconjugator
ID.creator: António Branco and Francisco Costa
University of Lisbon
Antonio.Branco@di.fc.ul.pt
ID.description: LX-Conjugator takes a Portuguese infinitive verb form and delivers the corresponding conjugated forms, providing fully-fledged Portuguese verb conjugation, including the full range of pronominal conjugation forms. For details, see http://lxconjugator.di.fc.ul.pt/lx-conjugator.html It thus handles: * Pronominal conjugation Additionally, LX-Conjugator exhaustively handles a set of inflection cases which tend not to be supported together in verbal conjugators: * Compound tenses * Double forms for past participles (regular and irregular) * Past participle forms inflected for number and gender (with transitive and unaccusative verbs) * Negative imperative forms * Courtesy forms for second person LX-Conjugator handles both known verbs and unknown verbs. It thus conjugates: * Neologisms (with orthographic infinitival suffix) It is also worth noting the following design principles, that LX-Conjugator adopts with respect to the so called defective verbs: * Defectives * Special cases LX-Conjugator handles the very few cases where there may be different forms in different variants: * Orthographic and paradigmatic differences *Other cases Aiming at optimizing readability and informativeness of the conjugation tables, LX-Conjugator adopts the following scheme concerning the displaying of clitics: * Clitic placement
Fully-fledged verb form generator for Portuguese

ID.title: lxlemmatizer
ID.creator: António Branco and Filipe Nunes
University of Lisbon
Antonio.Branco@di.fc.ul.pt
ID.description: LX-Lemmatizer takes a Portuguese verb form and delivers all the corresponding lemmata (infinitive forms) together with the inflectional feature values. Lemmata that are less likely, but still orthographically possible are also provided. For details, see http://lxlemmatizer.di.fc.ul.pt/lx-lemmatizer.html It handles: * Pronominal conjugation Additionally, LX-Lemmatizer exhaustively handles a set of inflection cases which tend not to be supported together in verbal lemmatizers: * Compound tenses * Double forms for past participles (regular and irregular) * Past participle forms inflected for number and gender * Negative imperative forms * Courtesy forms for second person * Neologisms (with orthographic suffix) * Defectives * Well formed clitic placement
Fully-fledged verbal lemmatizer for Portuguese, including ciltic handling

ID.title: lxinflector
ID.creator: António Branco, João Silva and Pedro Martins
University of Lisbon
Antonio.Branco@di.fc.ul.pt
ID.description: LX-Inflector is a tool for fully-fledged Portuguese nominal inflection and lemmatization. Fo details, see http://lxinflector/lx-inflector.html It takes as input: * A nominal form (noun or adjective, including adjectival forms of past participles) * Intended values of inflectional features of Gender and Number for the output. It delivers: * Inflectional features of the input form * Lemmata * Inflected forms (when available) of each lemmata in accordance with the values for inflectional features entered. LX-Inflector processes prefixed forms. It handles both simple and compound forms, and both known and unknown (neologisms) simple nominal forms that admit inflection.
Morphological analyzer and generator for Portuguese nominals

ID.title: lxner
ID.creator: António Branco, João Balsa and Eduardo Ferreira
University of Lisbon
Antonio.Branco@di.fc.ul.pt
ID.description: LX-NER takes a segment of text and identifies, circumscribes and classifies the expressions for named entities it contains. Furthermore, each named entity receives a standard representation. It handles the following types of expressions: * Numbers: Arabic; Decimal; Roman; Cardinal; Fraction; Magnitude class * Measures: Currency; Time; Scientifc units * Time: Date; Time periods; Time of the day: * Addresses * Names: Persons; Organizations; Localizations; Events; Works; Miscellaneous
Named-entity recognizer for Portuguese

ID.title: ICE - Intelligent Content Engineering
ID.creator: Klaus Netter, Hannes Meyer
DNC Dr. Netter Consulting GmbH
info@dn-c.de
ID.description: ICE is an independent client-server platform for content analysis and content engineering. The system integrates different component, such as text-classification, clustering, language identification, duplicate recognition, information extraction, etc. Each component can be configured and parametrised in individual workflows. New modules can be easily integrated and adapted to the workflow The platform includes interactive tools for the development and management of multi-lingual knowledge models, such as hierarchical classification trees, training and test data for AI-based categorisation, as well as rules and parameters for the configuration of components. Knowledge models can be deployed independently and simultaneously in different workflows (such as test or productive environments) or different instances. All functions can be monitored and evaluated through benchmarking devices. The system comes with elaborate reporting mechanisms which allow to view the results of the processing in detailed statistics. ICE is based on the Unstructured Information Management Architecture (UIMA) and can be accessed via web services. ICE is employed in large productive environments such as a world-wide news management system, web-monitoring solutions, archiving solutions, DMS or CMS systems etc.
Content analysis platform with a broad range of NLP modules, knowledge management and evaluation fu

ID.title: 1AiWay NLP for .NET
ID.creator: 1AiWay
1AiWay
publicr@1aiway.com
ID.description: "1AiWay NLP for .NET" is natural language processing software for .NET developers. It provides a complete solution to parse English text from a stream of characters directly into CLR types and up to the pragmatic level of understanding.
Converts English text into your CLR types.

ID.title: Carabao Language Kit
ID.creator: Digital Sonata Pty Ltd
info@digitalsonata.com
ID.description: A complete set of linguistic tools, including highly accurate and advanced text understanding component, morphological and semantic analyzer, translator, inline metrics/measures manipulator, machine readability indicator and translator. Commercial successor of Carabao DIY Machine Translation Kit (please remove the latter).
A complete suite of advanced NLP components & development tools

ID.title: OLIF dictionaries
ID.creator: Digital Sonata Pty Ltd
vadim.berman@digitalsonata.com
ID.description: Free and commercial OLIF XML dictionaries
n/a

ID.title: Poliqarp
ID.creator: Daniel Janus et al.
Institute of Computer Science, Polish Academy of Sciences
adamp@ipipan.waw.pl
ID.description: Poliqarp is a free (open source) set of tools for indexing and searching large corpora.
corpus indexer, search engine and concordancer

ID.title: Spejd
ID.creator: Daniel Buczyński and Adam Przepiórkowski
Institute of Computer Science, Polish Academy of Sciences
adamp@ipipan.waw.pl
ID.description: Spejd -- Shallow Parsing and Disambiguation Engine -- is a free (open source) tool for partial parsing and rule-based morphosyntactic disambiguation.
a tool for partial parsing and rule-based morphosyntactic disambiguation

ID.title: UIMA
ID.creator: Apache Software Foundation
Apache incubator
mbaessler@apache.org
ID.description: Unstructured Information Management applications are software systems that analyze large volumes of unstructured information in order to discover knowledge that is relevant to an end user. UIMA is a framework and SDK for developing such applications. An example UIM application might ingest plain text and identify entities, such as persons, places, organizations; or relations, such as works-for or located-at. UIMA enables such an application to be decomposed into components, for example "language identification" -> "language specific segmentation" -> "sentence boundary detection" -> "entity detection (person/place names etc.)". Each component must implement interfaces defined by the framework and must provide self-describing metadata via XML descriptor files. The framework manages these components and the data flow between them. Components are written in Java or C++; the data that flows between components is designed for efficient mapping between these languages. UIMA additionally provides capabilities to wrap components as network services, and can scale to very large volumes by replicating processing pipelines over a cluster of networked nodes.
Unstructured Information Management Architecture

ID.title: ROSummarizer
ID.creator: Victor Cobuz
Independent
victor.cobuz@nth-languge.com
ID.description: Summarization system for Romanian language based on a Bayesian classifier and a powerful keywords extraction algorithm.
Summarization system for Romanian language

ID.title: QuALiM
ID.creator: Michael Kaisser
University of Edinburgh
M.Kaisser@RemoveThis.sms.ed.ac.uk
ID.description: QuALiM is a Question Answering system. Unlike Search Engines (Google, for example), it aims to answer questions like "Who won the 2004 African Cup of Nations?" or "Where was Tom Cruise born?", rather than just provide links to pages or documents that might contain the information you're looking for. QuALiM will return accurate answers wherever possible. This particular web demo, QuALiM supplements its answers with relevant passages from Wikipedia, so it will not answer questions about topics not included in Wikipedia.
QuALiM Question Answering System - Searches Wikipedia

ID.title: Frequency
ID.creator: Victor Cobuz
Independent
victor.cobuz@nth-language.com
ID.description: You can analyze any given corpus or piece of text. The processing stage (in-memory) is very fast (15000 words per second). Also, the software extract the bi-grams. You can print and export the results in various formats, such as: Excel, Html, Text, Binary or CSV file.
A very fast text analysis tool. The results can be exported in various formats

ID.title: UAM CorpusToool
ID.creator: Mick O'Donnell
Universidad Autonoma de Madrid
michael.odonnell@uam.es
ID.description: UAM CorpusTool is software to support human annotation of plain text. The tool allows a corpus of text files to be annotated at a number of linguistic layers, which are defined by the user. For instance, one can annotate texts at the document layer (e.g., text type, writer characteristics, register, etc.), semantic-pragmatic levels, and at syntactic levels (e.g., clause, phrases, etc.). At each annotation layer, the user defines a hierarchy of tags appropriate for that layer, using a graphical tool. The user then annotates the text at each layer by swiping the text to indicate a segment, and then assigning features from the tag hierarchy at that layer. The tool includes interfaces for cross-layer searching, automatic tagging based on lexical pattern matching, and statistical comparisons between subcorpora.
Software for annotation of text

ID.title: What's Wrong With My NLP?
ID.creator: Sebastian Riedel
University of Edinburgh
sebastian.riedel@gmail.com
ID.description: Visualizer for NLP problems. Reads CoNLL formats and displays semantic and syntactic dependencies. Also provides several options to filter the current graph and to search a corpus using powerful search expressions. Can be used to graphically compare gold and system output.
NLP Visualizer

ID.title: LACrIMoSA
ID.creator: Johannes Dellert, Kilian Evang
University of Tübingen
kevang@sfs.uni-tuebingen.de
ID.description: LACrIMoSA is a graphical application that can be used to collect text from the Web, analyze the morphology of languages and search the collected corpora for "snippets" of text containing particular words. It is targeted mainly at people who study particular languages and want to explore their morpholoy or the usage of particular words in context. It helps them with focussing the exploration of the Web on the language(s) of interest and provides an information retrieval facility that takes word forms into account, without being hard-geared towards any particular set of languages.
language-adaptive crawler, inductor of morphology, and search application

ID.title: DISCO
ID.creator: Peter Kolb
University of Potsdam, Department of Linguistics
disco@linguatools.de
ID.description: DISCO allows to retrieve the semantic similarity between arbitrary input words, and lists the semantically most similar words for an input word. It consists of a multilingual database with a Java API. Pre-computed word spaces are available for a number of languages, so DISCO can be used off the shelf.
Database of semantic similarity in multiple languages with a Java API
